4.3.18  3:38 pm   How can I remember how many days are in each month?

     knuckles

     I know there's that one poem  '30 days hath...' .. but I can never remember the poem so that doesn't help.

     yea that's because most of the months rhyme

      I know Feb is 28 (or 29), I know Oct is 31 because of halloween, and I know July is 31 because of a friend's b-day.. but other than that, no idea which ones have 30 or 31 without looking at a calendar. 

     use the knuckles method. hold out your hands, palm down. make fists. look at the top of your knuckles. look at the knuckles and the spaces in between the knuckles. start counting the months from the left, with a month for each knuckle and space. the knuckles represent long months (31) and the spaces represent short months (30 or less). you will see they alternate until you reach the last knuckle (july), then you have to jump to your other hand and that's another knuckle (august) and keep going from there until you run out of months (december)

4.3.18  11:14 am   Sometimes when i'm writing a song, i'll sing a lyric that sort of doesn't make sense and i am stuck between changing it and keeping it because i like how it sounds. For example, i just sung "And i get stuck on the smallest of things, like a finger in a ring"

That almost works but fingers aren't really 'in' rings,

     ? sure they are

      rings go on fingers. But it sounds better the original way.

     and also makes sense. probably almost too much sense

      this ever happen to you?

     sometimes the right sounding lyric feels right and also feels like it makes sense but almost means its opposite, and i usually find it thrilling to leave it in. but yours already makes perfect sense and i'm not sure i understand your argument here

      i think i should probanly just not care and if anyone has a problem with it they can just stuff it, right? it is ironic because i am getting caufht up on this small part of the song which proves what i was singing

     that's true

     that wasn't a trade off. doing the history was a trade off, spending almost an entire year without doing any other songs or videos
